commitMessage:
feat(git-hooks): add ESLint validation to pre-push hook

Implements Phase 1 of HODGE-378 ("Stop the bleeding") by adding full ESLint 
validation to the pre-push hook. This prevents ESLint errors from reaching 
CI and provides immediate feedback to developers.

## What Changed

Implementation (2 files modified):
- `.husky/pre-push`: Added `run_eslint_check()` function (lines 128-154)
  - Runs `npm run lint` on entire codebase before every push
  - Integrated into main execution flow (lines 168-172)
  - Positioned after Prettier check, before npm audit
  - Supports `SKIP_LINT=true` environment variable for emergency bypass
  - Provides helpful error messages with fix instructions

- `test/pre-push-hook.test.ts`: Added 4 new smoke tests (+35 lines)
  - Validates `run_eslint_check()` function presence
  - Verifies `SKIP_LINT` environment variable support
  - Confirms ESLint check runs in main execution
  - Tests helpful error messages for failures

Documentation (13 files, 1,048 lines):
- Feature planning and tracking (exploration, build plan, PM tracking)
- Harden validation reports (review manifest, validation results, quality reports)
- All 1,369 tests passing, zero ESLint/TypeScript errors

## Why This Change

ESLint errors were reaching CI, breaking builds after developers pushed. This 
creates a gap where developers push broken code thinking it's fine. The 
pre-push hook closes this gap by running full ESLint validation locally 
before any push.

Key design decisions:
- **Always run**: No branch conditionals - runs for all pushes to prevent 
  errors from slipping through on feature branches
- **Emergency bypass**: `SKIP_LINT=true` escape hatch for emergencies while 
  keeping other checks active
- **Progressive checks**: Prettier (fast) โ ESLint (moderate) โ npm audit 
  (slow/cached) for optimal UX

## Impact

Developer Experience:
- โ Immediate feedback on ESLint errors before push
- โ Prevents broken builds in CI
- โ Clear error messages guide developers to fixes
- โ Emergency bypass available: `SKIP_LINT=true git push`

Code Quality:
- โ Zero ESLint errors enforced at push boundary
- โ Foundation for fixing existing errors (HODGE-378.2, 378.3, 378.4)
- โ All mandatory standards met (test isolation, no subprocess spawning)
- โ Comprehensive smoke tests ensure hook reliability

Technical:
- ~10-30s added to push time (acceptable for error prevention)
- Hook follows established patterns (consistent with existing checks)
- Shell script with proper error handling and exit codes
